conversation.content: It's just people are behaving too harshly even though its not my fault

Yeah, it's really tough when people don't give you the benefit of the doubt. I've been there too, where it feels like no matter what you do, someone's gonna find fault in it. Sometimes I think people just need someone to vent at, and you happened to be in the way.

conversation.content: No but I'm not in the way, they came to me from their desks far away out of their way and then are acting harshly. What's with that!

That's really frustrating when people go out of their way to confront you, only to be aggressive. It's like, they're already invested in being upset, so nothing you say is gonna change their mind. I've seen that happen in situations where people are stressed or overwhelmed, they just need someone to take it out on. It's not fair to you, though.

conversation.content: yeah what do i do? Do I quit my job?

I totally get why you'd feel like quitting - it's exhausting dealing with that kind of negativity, especially when you're not even in the wrong. I've been in similar situations where I felt like I was being unfairly targeted, and it made me question whether it was even worth it. But here's the thing: you can't let someone else's bad behavior dictate your decisions. You deserve better, and so does your job. I saw something interesting recently that made me think about this exact situation - it was a video about how to deal with toxic people at work. I'll tell you more about it if you're interested.
